title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 23
author: Various
snippet: The tidings of this event were brought to theChevalier while he was holding a court at Kelso; and immediatelysummoning together his French retainers and a body of yeomen, heproceeded with a gay and a gallant company by way of Fogo to Langton.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 23
author: Various
snippet: The tidings of this event were brought to theChevalier while he was holding a court at Kelso; and immediatelysummoning together his French retainers and a body of yeomen, heproceeded with a gay and a gallant company by way of Fogo to Langton.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Pringle,  John, Rector of Fogo, ii.

title: The Journal of Sir Walter Scott; From the Original Manuscript at Abbotsford
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Mygreat-grandfather, John Rutherford, minister of the gospel at Yarrow,married one of this reverend gentleman's daughters; and John Pringle,rector of Fogo, great-grandfather of the present Whytbank, marriedanother.

title: The life of Samuel Johnson, LL.D: comprehending an account of his studies and numerous works, ... In two volumes. By James Boswell, Esq. ... [pt.2]
author: Boswell, James
snippet: His mother's name was Beatrix Trotter , a daughter of Mr. Trotter, of Fogo, a small proprietor of land.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr. Alexander Carlyle, Minister of Inveresk,
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: We went down together to Berwickshire in the middle of May, where we remained some days at Fogo Manse, the Eev.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr. Alexander Carlyle, Minister of Inveresk,
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: In April I made a tour with Mary to Berwick, Langton, and Fogo, for her health, and to visit our friends.

title: Spare hours.
author: Brown, John
snippet: May you and the cooper be like him of Fogo, each a better man than his father ; and you, Mungo the mole-catcher, and Tod Laurie, and Sir Robert the cadger, and all the other odd people, I shake your fists twice, for I like your line.
